reviews.body:
## Pull Request Overview This PR introduces comprehensive documentation for Dreamflow's workspace interface, establishing a new documentation structure focused on the integrated development environment. The documentation covers the core workspace panels that provide Flutter development tools including widget management, property editing, code editing, and AI-powered assistance. - Restructures the documentation sidebar to include dedicated "Getting Started" and "Workspace" sections - Adds detailed documentation for five core workspace panels (modules, content, properties, agent) - Updates styling and branding elements to align with the new documentation structure ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 16 out of 24 changed files in this pull request and generated 16 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | src/css/custom.css | Updates typography, colors, and removes redundant dark mode styles | | sidebars.ts | Restructures navigation with new categorized sections for getting started and workspace | | firebase.json | Removes extensive redirect rules, simplifying the configuration | | docusaurus.config.ts | Updates GitHub repository references and removes blog link | | docs/workspace/ | Adds comprehensive workspace panel documentation with interactive demos | | docs/get-started/ | Adds welcome and quickstart guides for new users | | docs/index.md | Comments out support resources section |
Files not reviewed (1) * **.idea/modules.xml**: Language not supported
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.
@PoojaB26 added some comments. Also, I feel the fonts are too small, users on large screens will be sitting farther from the monitor and may find it difficult to read.

@PoojaB26, how about adding a divider between these sections? Since they‚Äôre not interrelated, a divider could help visually separate them and make the layout easier to scan.

I'm not sure about adding a divider because visually it doesn't look good and also this is a page with mostly lists of links, divider makes sense when we are actually dividing the content with drastic changes from each other but here its a linear list of links and the header already divides the content
Clicking on a page link does not highlight the corresponding page in the left sidebar. Before After
@pinkeshmars fixed it

title: Workspace Management Features and Permissions
body:
## Summary
This pull request introduces several enhancements to workspace management, including updates to team and workspace descriptions, member management, and permission controls.

## Description:

This pull request includes a range of features to improve workspace management and permission controls. Key updates include:

* Options to update team and workspace descriptions
* Ability to add/remove members and update their roles in a workspace
* Restricting workspace settings updates based on user role
* Limiting create/update/delete operations for users with a "reader" role
* Improving user visibility by only showing workspaces they are a member of
* Moving the theme switcher to the navigation dropdown for easier access

These changes aim to enhance the overall workspace management experience and provide more granular control over permissions and access.

title: Added mock flow for tenant verification and various updates
body:
## Description:
This pull request includes the addition of a mock flow to verify tenants during Google login, as well as enhancements such as navigating to news feed upon successful verification or displaying a message to install Monk in Slack workspace if unsuccessful. we've updated the API endpoint to https://api.heymonk.app.

The PR also includes fixes for auth0 callback errors for Flutter web and an update to the internal test build v1.0.0+1 on Test-flight. Furthermore, we've updated the login page UI and added options for users to display public channels and set channel preferences after login if not set previously. Lastly, we've updated the macOS launcher icon and favicon for web.


### Changelog:
- Added mock flow for tenant verification
- Updated API endpoint to https://api.heymonk.app
- Fixed auth0 callback error for Flutter web
- Released internal test build v1.0.0+1 on Test-flight
- Updated login page UI
- Added options display public channels of preference and set channel preference after login
- Updated macOS launcher icon 
- Updated favicon for web

title: Migration to Next.js for Performance Boost and Branding Updates
body:
## Description
This pull request is a major migration of the project from ReactJS and Node to Next.js due to performance issues. With this migration, we have seen significant improvements in the overall performance of the application.

In addition to the migration, there are changes related to the app's look and feel in terms of UI and UX, including updates to reflect a new brand name and assets. These changes aim to enhance user experience and make the application more visually appealing while aligning with the rebranding efforts.

Overall, this pull request represents a substantial update that not only addresses performance issues but also improves the overall appearance, usability, and branding consistency of the application.

title: feat: UI enhancements, game improvements, image optimization, and ESLint migration
body:
### Changes proposed

This PR includes the following updates:

* Added a welcome popup to the photography page with animations and multiple dismiss options
* Cleaned up unused and commented CSS from photography styles
* Enhanced the Snake (Konami) game with high scores, increasing speed, pause support, and mobile controls
* Migrated ESLint configuration to `eslint.config.mjs` and updated dependencies
* Improved image handling by migrating to Next.js `<Image>` and allowing Google Drive images
* Removed unused code and imports across the project

### ‚úîÔ∏è Check List

* [x] My code follows the code style of this project.
* [x] This PR does not contain plagiarized content.
* [x] The title of my pull request is a short description of the requested changes.

### Note to reviewers

* Photography popup uses CSS-based animations and appears on page load
* Snake game stores high scores in localStorage and improves mobile UX
* ESLint migration preserves existing rules while modernizing the setup
* All images now use Next.js optimization

---

If you want, I can also **compress this further to just bullet points** or **trim the reviewer notes to 2 lines**.

title: feat: Migrate blog images locally + refresh thumbnails + add build-time image validation
body:
<!-- If your PR fixes an open issue, use `Closes #101` to link your PR with the issue. #101 stands for the issue number you are fixing -->

### Fixes Issue

Closes #61 
Closes #60
Closes #62

<!-- Example: Closes #31 -->

### Changes proposed

- Moved all blog images to local public/blog-images/ and updated markdown paths (no Hashnode/dev.to CDN).
- Updated blog thumbnails and standardized blog UI thumbnail render size to 1200√ó900.
- Added build-time image validation (validate:images + prebuild) to fail builds on missing assets.
- Improved metadata/SEO (page + per-post OG/Twitter) and added RSS autodiscovery.
- Cleanup: removed one-off thumbnail scripts/docs, removed cover/, removed unused deps, and deleted top-docker-extensions post + assets.
